meanings.def: the main long, thin part of a plant above the ground from which the leaves or flowers grow; a smaller part that grows from this and supports flowers or leaves
examples: a tall plant with branching stems
There are several leaves on each stem.
When the bush has finished flowering, cut back all the stems.

meanings.def: the long, thin part of a wine glass between the bowl and the base
the thin tube of a tobacco pipe
having one or more stems of the type mentioned
the main part of a word that stays the same when endings are added to it
examples: ‘Writ’ is the stem of the forms ‘writes’, ‘writing’ and ‘written’.

meanings.def: all the way from the front of a ship to the back

idioms.def: all the way from the front of a ship to the back

meanings.def: science, technology, engineering and mathematics (used to refer to these subjects as a group in the context of education and jobs)
examples: We need to encourage more girls to enrol on STEM courses.

meanings.def: to stop something that is flowing from spreading or increasing
examples: The cut was bandaged to stem the bleeding.
They discussed ways of stemming the flow of smuggled drugs.
The government had failed to stem the tide of factory closures.
The reforms failed to stem social discontent.
